title: The Modern Job Search
description: Landing a job today requires a strategic and proactive approach. It's about marketing yourself effectively across multiple platforms and tailoring your application to each opportunity.
sentences: Your resume/CV should be a marketing document, not a historical record. Tailor it for every job application.
A complete and active LinkedIn profile is non-negotiable for most professional roles.
Prepare for interviews using the STAR method (Situation, Task, Action, Result) to structure your answers.
Networking is often the most effective job search strategy; leverage your connections.
Be prepared for multi-stage interviews, including technical rounds, HR discussions, and cultural fit assessments.
dos: Write a compelling cover letter that connects your skills to the company's needs.
Practice common interview questions with a friend.
Send a polite thank-you email after each interview stage.
Clean up your social media profiles to ensure they are professional.
donts: Don't mass-apply with a generic, one-size-fits-all resume.
Don't lie or exaggerate your skills and experience.
Don't discuss salary expectations too early in the process.
Don't stop searching after one or two good interviews; keep your options open.
